intro: Hemiandra pungens var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth hemiandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
